column4: OK, next n00b question:  when I do some action requiring root, what governs whether I get a password prompt for that action?  It seems to be remembering the root password sometimes (i.e. no PW prompt)
let me do a test to see if I can come up with a testcase to illustrate what I mean ...
if you used sudo within 5 min then it acutally keeps your status as "sudo"
what kind of card, memory, etc
some of the screensavers are GL, so they can also display fps
make sure dvi and glx are in the XF86Config file
turn on the logging in xchat so you can save the sessions
I'm actually using Chatzilla, I'll evolve to a better IRC client some day :)
are the other modelines in your XF86Config file?
oh boy, I get to remember all that old Xconfig stuff again ...
